content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The work shown is the Walt Disney Concert Hall, designed by Frank Gehry and built in Los Angeles in 2003 C.E. Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work. Using specific visual evidence, explain at least two ways in which the artist used these visual characteristics to create a sense of movement. Explain how the work departs from earlier architectural traditions in the United States.

Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work. Using specific visual evidence, explain at least two ways in which the artist used these visual characteristics to create a sense of movement. Explain how the work departs from earlier architectural traditions in the United States.

topic.text: 10.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Global Contemporary Art

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. form.  b. style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
